result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy W. Boe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of the two.  When not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol with random UA's to ensure compliance. 

No contact with victims.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA and follow through.  Write letter of apology to victim, R.B.T.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:52pm
INCLUDES 15CF1019, 15CM2362, 16CM48
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Deft appears with Atty Amanda Ley. 

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM2362:
Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500- repeter >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Theft-movable property <=$2500- repeater >> D&RI
16CM48:
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CF1019:
Ct. 1 Theft-movable property >$5000-$10,000- repeater >> NO CONTEST
16CM48:
Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstrucing an Officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
Parties make arguments made on length of probation and jail condition

COURT ORDERS:  In 16CM48 Ct. 1 & Ct. 3: I/S 2 years WSPS: 1 year IC, 1 year ES, consecutive. 15CF1019 Ct. 1: w/hold sentencing, 3 years probation. 16CM48 Ct. 1 & Ct. 3: w/hold sentencing, 2 years probation. Probation to run concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: I/S 4 months MCJ for rule violations on 16CM48 Ct. 1. CONDITIONS OF ALL: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, with random UA's to ensure compliance. Write letter of apology to victim- R.B.T. No contact with victims. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week. Pay restitution back to R.B.T. of $5,473.00 in 15CF1019 at rate of $155.00 per month. Pay restitution back to Pawn America in 15CM2362 of $41.56. (Restitution hearing to be set within 60 days) Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 1 day credit if revoked.
